etymologies: mid 19th century: apparently a double diminutive of Latin picus ‘woodpecker’

definitions: a tiny tropical woodpecker with a short unstiffened tail, found chiefly in Central and South America.

notes.text: Picumnus and other genera, family Picidae: numerous species, including the olivaceous piculet (P. olivaceus)

shortDefinitions: tiny tropical woodpecker with short tail, found chiefly in Central and South America
